move.description: Main action of the story, including setup, conflict, preparation, counteractions, and external help that drives the narrative.

setup.description: Initial context and situation of the hero, showing their state, environment, and relationships before any conflict.

initial_situation.description: Hero's initial state before the conflict, including their environment and relationships, laying the foundation for the story.

conflict.description: Problems and obstacles faced by the hero, including interdictions, lacks, struggles, marks received, connective incidents, and villain advantages.

hero_interdiction.description: Obstacles that prevent the hero from acting freely, including villainy, false marriages, expulsions, kidnappings, and murders.

villainy.description: Malicious acts by the antagonist that hinder the hero's action.

false_matrimony.description: Deceptions related to marriages or false promises that complicate the hero's situation.

expulsion.description: Expulsion of the hero from a safe environment, forcing their departure.

kidnapping.description: Kidnapping that separates the hero or important characters from their environment.

murder.description: Murder that aggravates the conflict and generates greater obstacles.

lack.description: Deficiencies that motivate the hero's action, including absence of a partner or material resources.

lack_of_bride.description: Absence of a necessary partner to achieve the hero's objectives.

lack_of_money.description: Lack of essential material resources that drives action.

hero_departure.description: Moment when the hero leaves their initial environment to face challenges.

struggle.description: Physical or moral conflicts of the hero, including direct confrontations with antagonists or their agents.

fight.description: Direct combat with the antagonist or their allies.

branding.description: Marks or physical signs the hero receives during conflict, either permanent or temporary injuries.

receive_mark.description: Permanent signs that identify the hero.

receive_injury.description: Physical injuries suffered during fights or confrontations.

connective_incident.description: Events that connect and advance the narrative, such as requests for help or decisions to depart.

call_for_help.description: Requests for assistance that drive the hero's or allies' actions.

departure_decision.description: Hero's decision to embark on their journey or mission.

villain_gains_information.description: Moments when the antagonist gains an advantage through information, increasing difficulty for the hero.

preparation.description: Planning and acquiring resources to face challenges, including temporary absence, violation of interdictions, obtaining objects and allies, guidance from mentors, strategies, and contact with the enemy.

absentation.description: Temporary separation from the environment to prepare the action.

breaking_interdiction.description: Violation of restrictions to advance the mission.

acquisition.description: Obtaining essential objects, allies, or knowledge, including gifts or tools.

get_present.description: Receiving gifts that aid the hero's mission.

guidance.description: Advice or direction provided by mentors to guide the hero.

return_event.description: Partial or full return of the hero to a previous environment during preparation.

make_contact_with_enemy.description: Direct interaction with the antagonist, either to confront or investigate.

mediation.description: Intervention of third parties to facilitate conflict resolution.

trickery.description: Strategies or deceptions used to overcome obstacles and adversaries.

beginning_of_counteraction.description: Start of the hero's active response to conflicts and obstacles.

helper_move.description: Intervention of allies or external forces to support the hero, including obtaining objects, resolving lacks, and rescues.

receipt_object.description: Obtaining magical, symbolic, or strategic objects that facilitate the mission.

liquidiation_of_lack.description: Resolution of initial deficiencies, such as freeing characters or the hero from captivity.

release_from_captivity.description: Release of detained characters or the hero themselves.

pursuit_and_rescue.description: Chasing the antagonist to rescue captives or secure victory.

false_hero_make_unfounded_claim.description: Appearance of a false hero who claims undeserved credit.

attempt_at_reconnaissance.description: Attempts to explore or gather information about the enemy to plan action.

resolution.description: Closure of the story with conflict resolution, hero's victory, recognition, punishment of the villain, transformations, and symbolic closure such as weddings or thrones.

victory.description: Hero's success, including definitive defeat of the antagonist.

villain_defeated.description: Definitive defeat of the antagonist, ensuring the hero's victory.

arrival.description: Hero's return or arrival at a new state, sometimes initially unrecognized.

unrecognised_arrival.description: Arrival without initial recognition, which may lead to the hero's final return home.

home_arrival.description: Hero's definitive return to their home or original environment.

difficult_task_with_solution.description: Resolution of complex challenges, from their posing to the action that solves them.

difficult_task.description: Significant challenge that the hero must overcome.

solution_difficult_task.description: Action that resolves the posed challenge, closing that part of the narrative.

resolution_function.description: Conclusion that establishes justice, recognition, and reward, including punishment of the villain and reward for the hero.

recognition.description: Acknowledgment of the hero's merits for their actions.

punishment.description: Sanctioning the antagonist for their deeds.

reward.description: Reward given to the hero after overcoming conflicts.

exposure_of_villain.description: Revealing the true nature of the antagonist, showing their guilt.

transfiguration.description: Transformations after resolution, both physical and psychological of the hero.

physical_transformation.description: Visible physical changes reflecting the hero's evolution.

psychological_transformation.description: Hero's internal evolution, including maturity and character changes.

wedding_or_throne.description: Symbolic or literal closure of the story, including marriages or ascension to power.

wedding.description: Marriage as a symbol of union and narrative resolution.

get_throne.description: Ascension to power or prominent position as closure of the hero's arc.
